alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 03 at 12:15PM EDT until April 03 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Houston County in southeastern Alabama... Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Holmes County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northwestern Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Miller County in southwestern Georgia... Southern Early County in southwestern Georgia... Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 115 PM EDT/1215 PM CDT/. * At 1215 PM EDT/1115 AM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Columbia to near Dothan to near Geneva, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Bonifay, Geneva, Marianna, Graceville, Headland, Dothan, Donalsonville, Blakely, Hartford, Taylor, Kinsey, Ashford, Slocomb, Samson, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia and Chattahoochee. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
